You can create an RateOfChange indicator object that is not bounded to any automatic update and choose which data it should use. To use it, please refer to the reference table below.

RateOfChange()1/1

            RateOfChange QuantConnect.Indicators.RateOfChange (
    *string                       name,
    Int32                        period,
   )

Creates a new RateOfChange indicator. This will compute the n-period rate of change in the security. The indicator will be automatically updated on the given resolution.

Parameters
*string name (Optional) The custom name of the indicator whose RateOfChange we want.
Int32 period The period over which to compute the RateOfChange.

Return

RateOfChange - The RateOfChange indicator for the requested name over the specified period

Definition at file Indicators/RateOfChange.cs.


You can use two methods to update the indicator: automatic or manual.

Automatic Update

In this method, you will recreate the basic indicator usage: create the indicator with its constructor and register the indicator for automatic updates with the RegisterIndicator() method, but could be using a custom resolution via a Consolidator.

private RateOfChange _roc;
// In Initialize()
_roc = new RateOfChange(period);
_roc.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _roc, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_roc.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _roc.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.roc = RateOfChange(period)
self.roc.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.roc, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.roc.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.roc.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually allows you to control which data is used and create indicators of other non-regular price fields. The indicator objects have the Update() method that updates the state of the RateOfChange indicator with the given a trade bar, a quote bar, or a custom data bar.

With this method, the indicator will only be ready after the Update() method has been used to pump enough data.

private RateOfChange _roc;
// In Initialize()
_roc = new RateOfChange(period);

// In OnData()
if (data.ContainsKey(symbol))
{
    _roc.Update(data[symbol].EndTime, data[symbol].High);
}
if (_roc.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _roc.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.roc = RateOfChange(period)

# In OnData()
if data.ContainsKey(symbol):
    self.roc.Update(data[symbol].EndTime, data[symbol].High)
if self.roc.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.roc.Current.Value
